meanings.definition: To cause (someone) to remember someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She kept reminding her friend about the upcoming party.
meanings.sent2: The sticky note on the fridge was reminding him to buy milk.
meanings.sent3: The alarm clock was reminding the sleepyhead to wake up and start the day.
meanings.sent4: The old photograph reminding her of the happy times they shared together.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the ocean waves crashing against the shore was a constant reminding of their beach vacation.

meanings.definition: To serve as a reminder of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The calendar on the wall is reminding us of our friend's birthday.
meanings.sent2: The smell of freshly baked cookies is reminding me of my grandma's kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The chirping birds outside are reminding us that spring is here.
meanings.sent4: The old lighthouse on the cliff reminding sailors of the dangers lurking in the dark waters.
meanings.sent5: The scent of pine trees in the forest was a powerful reminding of the peacefulness of nature.
